intro: Dacryodes buettneri, commonly known as the African snowbell, is a tropical tree native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are followed by spherical, greenish-yellow fruits. Its latex is milky and has been used traditionally for various purposes, including as a chewing gum. The tree is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
